title: Kinkonauts bring Shakespearean tomfoolery with 'Much Ado From Nothing'
text:
Report an error 
Somewhere in a quiet graveyard in Stratford Upon Avon, the ghost of William Shakespeare is probably feeling a tad queasy. 
The Kinkonauts, Calgary's long-form improv company, is promising two nights of improvised Shakespeare or, as their fearless leader Stephen Kent likes to call them, the Shakespeare plays that have yet to be written. 
It is aptly called Much Ado From Nothing: An Improvised Shakespeare Play . 
"At the beginning of the evening, we ask the audience to give us a title for a possible Shakespeare play. 
"That title and what happens when we accept the challenge will determine whether we create a comedy, tragedy or history," says Kent admitting "it really depends on how many characters are left standing at the end of the evening. 
"If almost everyone gets married, the audience has seen a comedy but if almost everyone is dead they've seen a tragedy." 
What Kent can promise is that most of the important elements of any Shakespeare will occur. 
"There will be sword fights, ghosts, disguises, kisses, lovers, poisons, letters, mangled British accents and possibly a guest appearance from Sir Ian McKellan or Sir Patrick Stewart." 
Kent says that there are stock characters in Shakespeare that usually find their way into whatever new play is being created but for certain there will be someone from that bumbling troupe of players in A Midsummer Night's Dream better known as the mechanicals. 
In A Midsummer Night's Dream , Nick Bottom the weaver and would-be thespian gets turned into an ass and he is always waiting to make an appearance in a Kinkonauts play but he could be wearing a horse's head or even a giraffe's. 
There will be at least seven improvisers from the Kinkonauts' 40-strong troupe on stage each evening, but often guest improvisers drop in to be part of something as much fun as a Shakespeare night. 
The Kinkonauts will unleash their madcap tomfoolery Oct. 23 and 24 at 8 p.m. each evening at the Evergreen Theatre in Mayland Heights (1709 8th Ave. N.E.) 
For more information or to reserve tickets for Much Ado From Nothing go to kinkonauts.com Sponsored Links
